description:
Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world.

As part of YouTube Trust and Safety, you will be directly responsible for making the internet safer, protecting free speech and defending our brand. You are passionate about cutting-edge policy developments and applications in a digital age. You want to help define how people around the world communicate with one another and express their points of view through YouTube. You thrive in a fast, dynamic, demanding environment where no two days are ever the same. You will build robust relationships with Legal, Policy and PR stakeholders, while also helping to define and implement policy solutions relating to urgent policy issues.

As a Policy Enforcement Manager, you'll be responsible for ensuring that we deliver on our end-to-end performance goals for your assigned policy area, including finding the right balance between removing violating content while keeping up good content. You'll help to implement and enforce our policies across millions of videos. You'll define the operational plan and you implement it globally, working with stakeholders in Engineering, Vendor Operations, Analytics, Policy and Legal. You ensure that we deliver innovations to automate as much as possible, while improving quality and acting as the escalation point to the vendor team in complex cases.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Experience in internet services, consulting, process improvement or other relevant work.
  • Experience in project and process management, including leading cross-functional projects.
  • Ability to work non-standard hours and differing work rotations/shifts as required (including working on holidays and shift rotations).
  • Ability to speak and write in English and Brazilian Portuguese fluently and idiomatically

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience in content policy, anti-abuse or customer support operations, including reviewing content and/or answering user questions and working with vendors.
  • Ability to manage complex scaled enforcement projects and investigations from creation to delivery.
  • Demonstrated analytical skills, including the ability to use data to drive strategy and business action.
  • Demonstrated business judgment with effective influencing and communication skills. Ability to build robust relationships with cross-functional partners across geographies.
responsibilities:
• Deliver performance end-to-end for a given policy area, working in partnership with key cross-functional partners. Drive data-based decisions and implement key changes to improve performance.
  • Analyze, identify, prioritize and deliver operational improvement opportunities. Identify, articulate and quantify impact of required tools changes to deliver operational improvement opportunities.
  • Handle escalations from vendors for complex cases and use this input to feed into operational improvement plans.
  • Partner with Policy, Engineering, Vendor Operations and Analytics teams to define the best plan and implement quickly.
  • Review online content.
title: Policy Enforcement Manager, Trust and Safety, YouTube (Brazilian Portuguese)
